The sushi was great, and the pairings of flavors and fish were very good. I came at the recommendation of a friend, this isn't really my scene normally. My friend told me the omakase was good value for the quality is really good, and it was! I'd definitely give it another visit the next time I'm in the bay area.
author: Eric H.

description: Shared a 30-pc sashimi sampler, and all of the fish (king salmon from AK, maguro, yellowtail, fluke, snapper) was *delicious*.  Roll on the side was very good, too... as was the Japanese uni.  They were out of a couple of sake and beer selections, but the services was top-notch and the remodel is beautiful!
author: Don N.

description: This is definitely my new favorite restaurant for Omakase. Everything I had was so delicious and fresh. Papaya with uni sauce was my favorite dish, I've never had anything like this! Tony Li, the owner is amazing! Will definitely be back for the food and service!
author: J.J. P.

description: we had a great time here last night. when omakase is done right it's hard to rank one place over another. so i'll just say that kingza is on equal footing with robin, kusakabe or sushi hon. just sit at the counter and let chef tony take care of you... absolutely outstanding.
author: Sanil S.

description: I make it a point to try to visit the best sushi restaurant I can whenever I visit a new city. Little did I know as a San Francisco resident that the best sushi I've ever had would be right around the corner. This place was absolutely incredible. The Omakase had the perfect mix of creative dishes and presentations and straight up amazing traditional sushi straight from Japan. Get it. I'm coming back every week. I'd put money on this place having a Michelin by next year.
author: David B.

description: Came here with a bunch of friends on a Saturday evening. Had an incredible experience. Chef Tony's culinary expertise was on full display as he crafted beautiful dishes throughout our 2 hour Omakase journey.  Will visit very soon.
author: Eric L.

description: We had dinner here with another couple . Had toro appetizer that was delicious. 3 out of 4 of us are not fans of urchin but the 4th really enjoyed the urchin. Ordered 2 sushi platters to share and fish was fresh and tasty. Also had edamame and another appetizer. Dragon roll was good but not what I expected. Thought was soft shell crab but was a fish dish. Would have liked to try the omikase which has been reviewed by others.
author: E T.

description: Decent sushi spot for the price.  The sushi chef appeared to be a bit new/green even though I read somewhere that he was a master apprentice under someone famous (I could be making that up). The sushi pieces were ok but interestingly enough, the non-sushi dishes were relatively better.  I feel like too many restaurants are trying to appear to be high-end (ie. high priced) while really being just a regular japanese restaurant in reality.  Kingza fits that bill from my perspective.
author: Joe P.

description: Chef Tony is amazing. Kingza is one of my favorite Japanese omakase restaurant in the Bay Area now. Everything is so good and all the fishes are so fresh. The highlight of the omakase is the toro and a5. They melted in my mouth immediately. If you are a sushi lover, please visit Kingza before they hit Michelin stars. I can't wait to come back with all my sushi lover friends. You will not regret coming here for omakase!
author: Iris L.

description: I can't stop coming back! Highly recommend the omakase that Chef Tony prepares, which varies daily. Everything is super fresh and just melts in your mouth! I've never left disappointed, sushi lovers must try!!!
author: Jen Y.

description: Not so happy. Paid 230 for 2 people with 2 sake each, appetizers and main course, which is way too much for what we got. Service was ok but awkward sometimes. The nigiris had way too much wasabi. One of the appetizers, wagyu with truffle, was just too small for the $35. The ice cream dessert had 0 taste, definitely not home made.
author: Kevin I.

description: Tony was really good. Highly recommend this restaurant. Nicely done Mr. Tony. Will recommend this to friends. :)
author: Sean P.

description: This new sushi place has replaced the old Kiji with a new decor and new chef and it's simply amazing. I have eaten sushi around the world for decades and this rank among the best. Sushi chef Tony is simply awesome. I highly recommend their omakase experience.
author: Sylvio D.

description: We loved Kingza! Very attentive service, fresh fish, and tasty flavors.  We sat at the bar and ordered Omakase .  Tony is a great chef and we loved everything he put in front of us -- especially the toro and uni dishes.  Highly recommend!
author: Jamie B.

description: Food is impeccable. The detailed to attention was absolutely amazing. I wish I can keep doing refills. My fav was the Hokkaido uni and waygu beef! I haven't had a better four hours dinner in as long as I can remember!!!
author: Becca L.

description: Nice natural wood counter tops, good service and excellent omakasse . The chef Tony Li was the youngest protege of Masa in New York the only 3 Michelin star sushi restaurant in America. My favorite dish is wagyu beef nagiri.
author: Howard X.

description: Incredibly fresh, delicious sushi and all the sides are also fresh and tasty.  And not too pricey, given the clearly well-planned menu.  Great sake selections, excellent atmosphere.  Four stars because the service took a loooong time, even for a high end sushi place.  Will happily return.
author: George G.

description: sushi chef used to work under michelin 3 star  restaurant in new york . high recommended!
author: Angel M.

description: Really nice neighborhood sushi spot with hard to find Japanese beers and sake and awesome appetizers. The rice is excellent. The fish is served at the perfect temperature. Really attentive service. We called them to ask if we could dine with or baby. They reserved a table for us in a quiet corner and checked in early and often. Promptly gave us the deck when he started stirring. Really thoughtful. Thank you.
author: Sub S.

description: This is my new favorite Japanese restaurant for my sushi cravings . The fish was fresh and perfectly prepared. The most delicious piece was the toro, it just melts in your mouth. The sushi chef Tony is amazing with the knife. Can't wait to go back!
author: Mike S.

description: Came here tonight with some friends and man were we blown away by this secret gem! One of the best Omakase experiences I've had in the Bay Area and the master chef carefully crafts each course with great care and passion...! If you're ever looking for a great Sushi meal, I highly recommend trying Kingza! I will definitely be back for more very soon!
author: Alex T.

description: Wow , so delicious. The chefs special was well worth it . This is my to go place when I come to SF. Very fresh.
author: Johnna G.

description: Unfortunately a let down. Fish was fresh, but all dishes were VERY small. Green tea was half a cup, too strong, with no refills. Nothing was noteworthy. :-/
author: Greg B.

description:
Not sure what the 1 star review is about, this place is great.

I was walking by and decided to give this place a try. Service was good and the decor was well thought out. Food was good, presentation was good. I tried:

- Oyster with Uni (and ponzu?): Great
- Wagyu and Fois Gras nigiri: Good
- Toro: Great
- Uni: Incredible (among the best I've had in the city!!)
- Live scallop: Also incredible - must try
- Hon-maguro: Good
- King salmon: Good

Give this place a try if you're in the area. Pricy, but worth it.

l'll be back!
author: Boris C.

description: First time trying this resteraunt. Really surprise to the  special that they have. We try out the oyster, uni and okoze(seasonal fish). Seasonal fish is sprising good, sweet and fresh with its own flavor. Oyster is really special too with their homemade source. Good sercive and good environment for dating. Happy to find out this resteraunt, will come back for sure!
author: Betty M.

description: Best dining experience I've ever had. Tony is the nicest sushi chef and the meal was incredible. Great atmosphere, amazing creative appetizers for the omaske starter, highest quality fish for omakse sushi course. Wonderful mango sorbet for dessert. Staff was so friendly. Best meal!
author: Kendal K.

description: Wow is all I can say. Tony is a sushi GOD. Omakase all the way. Didn't think anyone could do the things he does with fish. Tops all charts.
author: Ilya P.

description: Tony is one in a million. What a great spirit and his sushi is a reflection of that. I am back here every time I come back to San Francisco. Tonisan thank you @iamsaad
author: Brandt B.

description: The best sushi restaurant that I ever had. Tony is a Michelin 3 star chef in New York. The food is so delicious. One word "amazing"
author: Jenicababy L.

description: Amazing sushi for a very reasonable price! Wait staff is a little new and unfamiliar with the menu, but otherwise the service is spot on. I had the sushi tasting which offered a fantastic selection of fresh fish.
author: Chris L.

description: Had a great dinner. Server was attentive, but not overbearing. Food was phenomenal, fish was fresh and the chef knew exactly what to do with it! I will be back. Worth every penny!
author: Jessica F.

description: Charming NEW sushi place!!! Quality food - truly fresh fish!!! Loved the counter experience- very friendly service. Love the decor- authentic style!!!! Good luck guys !!! You rock!
author: Lapa L.

description: One of the best sushi places my wife and I have tried, so we made sure to make more reservations after the first bite. We both went for the omakase and was not disappointed. Every single piece was very flavorful. Usually, when we go to other high rated restaurants for omakase, there are "filler dishes" that are OK; however, here, all dishes were excellent. Reservations for 2 at 7:30PM was very easy. We were seated immediately and was able to order drinks promptly. Almost at all times our sake was poured for us, which was nice. The staff is very friendly. Being seated at the bar made the experience even better. The chef, Tony, provided great hospitality and comped some dishes and drinks that we were gladly expecting to pay for. The price is VERY fair, relative to other highly rated sushi spots in SF, but the quality and flavor of the food was excellent, if not better. Every dish was memorable. The ambiance is louder and has a lounge feel, compared to Maruya and Omakase, but not distracting. Environment is OK, but the food was excellent. Can't wait to be back there on Friday :).
author: Tommy L.

description: The food was delicious. I think it's the best sushi restaurant. The chef was nice and friendly. I love the uni best and the beef.
author: Simon R.

description: We came in with such high expectations for omakase. Having made our reservation a week in advance, we expected that there wouldn't be a struggle to keep up with the demand. Almost everyone present was there for omakase, and it seemed like both the sushi bar and waiting staff could not keep up. The wait time between dishes was extremely inconsistent. We waited 10 minutes, sometimes 25 minutes, in between courses, which really set off the flow of the meal. Some of my courses that were meant to be hot dishes came out cold. The chef did not realize we were given a certain type of sashimi once already. The head chef was also too busy chatting with friends at the sushi bar. We had a party of three people for 7pm on a Sunday and stayed until 10pm. Three hours for omakase is excessive, especially when the experience is subpar to begin with. Despite the lack of service and the tremendous wait time for our food, the quality of their fish is great, just not worth the time.
author: Evelyn C.

description: I highly recommended, that was the best sushi I ever had. The chef Tony, he was super nice and explained every single stuff. Great food and great service.
author: Kimmy L.

description: Service is slow and portions are small relative to the price.  The food is tasty and creative but be prepared to shell out $$$.
author: Yvonne Y.

description: Great new sushi spot. Delicious fresh fish and friendly staff. I'll definitely be back again :)
author: Jackie R.

description: Kingza is pleasant and the food is good but it is fairly pricey by neighborhood sushi restaurant standards.  I didn't feel that there was anything special about it that justified those prices.  That they have kept the Michelin stickers on the window (which relate to the the prior restaurant) is rather deceptive.
author: Peter H.

description: Went here last week with two of my friends, a brand new Japanese restaurant having its soft open now. Very inviting design, sit by the bar is Omakase only, we learned the chief Tony li is the youngest protege of Masa the 3 star Michelin star Japanese restaurant in NY. After the first course, our friends dive in to a very unique lesson and amazing tasting on nagari tasting. Every bite is so good that the fish ,ponzu and rice are so well balanced for the first time I don't need my soy sauce and wasabi!! That's how sushi suppose to taste in Japan!!! One suggestion I want to see more cook food menu
author: 秀祺

description: An amazing new sushi restaurant with excellent quality fish, a talented sushi chef and great service. They also have a really impressive beer and sake selection. Can't wait to go back.
author: JEFF B.

description: My partner and I dined at Kingza last night and had an amazing dinner. I highly recommend trying this new Mission Japanese restaurant!  We started with Kumamoto Oysters with a special chefs sauce. The miso soup was delicious, the sushi was the freshest I have had in recent memory and the service was exceptional. So nice to have such a great Japanese restaurant with in a few blocks of home. Welcome to the neighborhood. We will be back.
author: Debra C.

description: This is an amazing place! We were visiting from NYC and specifically were looking for an awesome sushi place that was intimate, and this hit it on the head perfectly! Sushi Chef Tony makes the experience amazing. Formerly of Masa and a former New Yorker, he made us feel so welcomed and even added additional pieces to the Omakase (foie gras over rice that MELTS in your mouth!) and another taste of Toro!!! He was a great conversationalist that you know is doing this because he loves it AND because he's damn good at it. He took the time to address every single person at the bar to make sure they were enjoying themselves and that they had enough pieces (adding extra if you weren't full)! He even took a shot of sake with us. The quality of the fish was on point - fresh, perfectly seasoned, and each one well crafted! We've been to quite a few of the former Masa sushi chefs in NYC (I.e. Neta back when Nick and Jimmy first opened it and was actually really good) and this one is right up there with them. The intimacy was equivalent to many more expensive sushi restaurants. It shows that Tony is looking to build relationships with his clientele and there were a couple of repeat customers in there... obviously for a reason! Wonderful place! P.S. when making your reservation, make sure to ask for omakase ahead of time (otherwise you'll get seated at a table).
author: Sophia T.
